meanings.definition: A person or thing that hauls in.
meanings.sent1: The inhaulers on the ship helped bring in the heavy fishing nets.
meanings.sent2: The inhaulers at the construction site pulled the materials to the top floor.
meanings.sent3: The inhaulers in the tug-of-war competition were determined to win.
meanings.sent4: The inhaulers of success never give up easily.
meanings.sent5: The inhaulers in the story were portrayed as heroes for their hard work.

meanings.definition: A device used for hauling in.
meanings.sent1: The fishermen relied on the inhaulers to reel in their catch.
meanings.sent2: The winch served as an efficient inhauler for the heavy machinery.
meanings.sent3: The inhauler in the garage made lifting heavy objects much easier.
meanings.sent4: The inhauler hummed as it smoothly brought the load closer.
meanings.sent5: The inhauler's mechanism was simple yet effective in its function.

meanings.sent1: The inhaulers of the fishing nets required strength and coordination.
meanings.sent2: The inhaulers of the ropes worked together to bring the boat to shore.
meanings.sent3: The inhaulers of the luggage cart raced to see who could finish first.
meanings.sent4: The inhaulers of the team pulled with synchronized effort.
meanings.sent5: The inhaulers of the goods ensured timely delivery to the customers.
